qas.question: What countries are great powers mostly based on economic reasons?
Due to lack of strategic and hard power, countries are excluded from what?
What is the name for the grouping of countries of China, France, Russia and the United Kingdom; Germany and Japan?
What two countries are great powers because of their hard power capabilities?
What grouping of world powers has Japan been a member of?

plausible_answers.text: permanent seats and veto power on the UN Security Council

qas.question: What benefits do middle power countries have as permanent members at the UN?

plausible_answers.text: the third and fourth largest economies

qas.question: How large are France and Russia's economies?
What are the five permanent Security Council Members lacking militarily?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>Japan and Germany<b3_0/><a0_0/> are great powers too, though due to their large advanced economies (having <b6_0>the third and fourth largest economies<b6_0/> respectively) rather than their strategic and hard power capabilities (i.e., the lack of <b5_0>permanent seats and veto power on the <a1_0>UN Security Council<b5_0/><a1_0/> or <b7_0>strategic military reach<b7_0/>). Germany has been a member together with the five permanent Security Council members in the <b4_0>P5+1 grouping<b4_0/> of world powers. Like China, France, Russia and the United Kingdom; Germany and Japan have also been referred to as <a2_0>middle powers<a2_0/>.
